content: Ignoring for a moment that this is a false dichotomy (there is a whole spectrum of options in-between), your article doesn’t really address the fact that, at the end of the day, what most people want is meat, and lots of it. While this is obviously unsustainable, it seems to me like exploring biotech innovations to address the problem is a sensible idea. For example, imagine a situation in which edible fungi are grown in vats fed on agricultural waste — would that be a bad idea?
